briefdescription.para: Change layout default DPI.
No command suppression.
Layout undo commands, used for collapsing undo commands.
Z-value for page (paper) items.
Minimum z value for items.
Z-value for page grids.
Z-value for page guides.
Z-value for smart (item bounds based) guides.
Z-value for mouse handles.
Z-value for temporary view tool items.
Z-value for snapping indicator.
Preset item z-values, to ensure correct stacking.
List of multiframe objects.
Item ID for layout map to use for the world file generation.
Construct a new layout linked to the specified project.

detaileddescription.para: If the layout is a "new" layout (as opposed to a layout which will restore a previous state from XML) then initializeDefaults() should be called on the new layout.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &parentElement, const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context, QPointF *position=nullptr, bool pasteInPlace=false)
memberdef.name: addItemsFromXml

briefdescription.para: Add items from an XML representation to the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Used for project file reading and pasting items from clipboard.

The position argument is optional, and if it is not specified the items will be restored to their original position from the XML serialization. If specified, the items will be positioned such that the top-left bounds of all added items is located at this position.
The pasteInPlace argument determines whether the serialized position should be respected, but remapped to the origin of the page corresponding to the page at position.
A list of the newly added items is returned.

briefdescription.para: Adds an item to the layout.

detaileddescription.para: This should be called instead of the base class addItem() method. Ownership of the item is transferred to the layout.

briefdescription.para: Adds a multiFrame to the layout.

detaileddescription.para:
The object is owned by the layout until removeMultiFrame() is called.
removeMultiFrame()
multiFrames()

briefdescription.para: Clears the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method removes all items and pages from the layout.

briefdescription.para: Creates a clone of the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of the return layout is transferred to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Converts a length measurement from the layout's native units to a specified target unit.

simplesect.para: length of measurement in specified units

briefdescription.para: Converts a size from the layout's native units to a specified target unit.

simplesect.para: size of measurement in specified units

briefdescription.para: Converts a point from the layout's native units to a specified target unit.
Converts a measurement into the layout's native units.

simplesect.para: length of measurement in layout units

briefdescription.para: Converts a size into the layout's native units.

simplesect.para: size of measurement in layout units

briefdescription.para: Converts a point into the layout's native units.
Creates a new layout undo command with the specified text and parent.

detaileddescription.para: The id argument can be used to specify an id number for the source event - this is used to determine whether QUndoCommand command compression can apply to the command.

briefdescription.para: Creates an expression context relating to the layout's current state.

detaileddescription.para: The context includes scopes for global, project, layout and layout context properties.

briefdescription.para: Returns list of keys stored in custom properties for the layout.
Read a custom property from the layout.

parameterdescription.para: default value to return if property with matching key does not exist

briefdescription.para: Clears any selected items in the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Call this method rather than QGraphicsScene::clearSelection, as the latter does not correctly emit signals to allow the layout's model to update.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the layout's grid settings, which stores settings relating to grid appearance, spacing and offsets.
Returns a reference to the layout's grid settings, which stores settings relating to grid appearance, spacing and offsets.
Creates a new group from a list of layout items and adds the group to the layout.

detaileddescription.para:
If grouping was not possible, a nullptr will be returned.
ungroupItems()

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the layout's guide collection, which manages page snap guides.
Returns a reference to the layout's guide collection, which manages page snap guides.
Initializes an empty layout, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: by adding a default page to the layout. This should be called after creating a new layout.

briefdescription.para: Returns a layout item given its id.

detaileddescription.para:
Since item IDs are not necessarely unique, this function returns the first matching item found.
itemByUuid()

briefdescription.para: Returns the layout item with matching template uuid unique identifier, or a nullptr if a matching item could not be found.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike itemByUuid(), this method ONLY checks template UUIDs for a match.

Template UUIDs are valid only for items which have been added to an existing layout from a template. In this case the template UUID is the original item UUID at the time the template was created, vs the item's uuid() which returns the current instance of the item's unique identifier.
Note that template UUIDs are only available while a layout is being restored from XML.

briefdescription.para: Returns the layout item with matching uuid unique identifier, or a nullptr if a matching item could not be found.

detaileddescription.para: If includeTemplateUuids is true, then item's template UUID will also be tested when trying to match the uuid. This may differ from the item's UUID for items which have been added to an existing layout from a template. In this case the template UUID returns the original item UUID at the time the template was created, vs the item's uuid() which returns the current instance of the item's unique identifier. Note that template UUIDs are only available while a layout is being restored from XML.

briefdescription.para: Returns the items model attached to the layout.
Calculates the bounds of all non-gui items in the layout.

detaileddescription.para:
Ignores snap lines, mouse handles and other cosmetic items.
ignorePages
set to true to ignore page items
margin
optional marginal (in percent, e.g., 0.05 = 5% ) to add around items
layout bounds, in layout units.
pageItemBounds()

briefdescription.para: Returns the topmost layout item at a specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Ignores paper items. If ignoreLocked is set to true any locked items will be ignored.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPointF position, const QgsLayoutItem *belowItem, bool ignoreLocked=false) const
memberdef.name: layoutItemAt

briefdescription.para: Returns the topmost layout item at a specified position which is below a specified item.

detaileddescription.para: Ignores paper items. If ignoreLocked is set to true any locked items will be ignored.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of layout items of a specific type.
Returns a list of layout objects (items and multiframes) of a specific type.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context, bool clearExisting=true, bool *ok=nullptr)
memberdef.name: loadFromTemplate

briefdescription.para: Load a layout template document.

detaileddescription.para: By default this method will clear all items from the existing layout and real all layout settings from the template. Setting clearExisting to false will only add new items from the template, without overwriting the existing items or layout settings.
If ok is specified, it will be set to true if the load was successful.
Returns a list of loaded items.

briefdescription.para: Lowers an item down the z-order.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the item was successfully lowered.

If deferUpdate is true, the scene will not be visibly updated to reflect the new stacking order. This allows multiple raiseItem() calls to be made in sequence without the cost of updating the scene for each one.

briefdescription.para: Lowers an item down to the bottom of the z-order.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the item was successfully lowered. If deferUpdate is true, the scene will not be visibly updated to reflect the new stacking order. This allows multiple raiseItem() calls to be made in sequence without the cost of updating the scene for each one.

briefdescription.para: Raises an item up to the top of the z-order.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the item was successfully raised.

If deferUpdate is true, the scene will not be visibly updated to reflect the new stacking order. This allows multiple raiseItem() calls to be made in sequence without the cost of updating the scene for each one.

briefdescription.para: Returns the layout multiframe with matching uuid unique identifier, or a nullptr if a matching multiframe could not be found.

detaileddescription.para: If includeTemplateUuids is true, then the multiframe's QgsLayoutMultiFrame::templateUuid() will also be tested when trying to match the uuid. Template UUIDs are valid only for items which have been added to an existing layout from a template. In this case the template UUID is the original item UUID at the time the template was created, vs the item's uuid() which returns the current instance of the item's unique identifier. Note that template UUIDs are only available while a layout is being restored from XML.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of multi frames contained in the layout.
Returns a pointer to the layout's page collection, which stores and manages page items in the layout.
Returns a pointer to the layout's page collection, which stores and manages page items in the layout.
Returns the bounding box of the items contained on a specified page.

detaileddescription.para: A page number of 0 represents the first page in the layout.
Set visibleOnly to true to only include visible items.
The returned bounds are in layout units.

briefdescription.para: The project associated with the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Used to get access to layers, map themes, relations and various other bits. It is never null.

briefdescription.para: Raises an item up the z-order.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the item was successfully raised.

If deferUpdate is true, the scene will not be visibly updated to reflect the new stacking order. This allows multiple raiseItem() calls to be made in sequence without the cost of updating the scene for each one.

briefdescription.para: Sets the collection's state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
layoutElement is the DOM node corresponding to the layout.
writeXml()

briefdescription.para: Returns the map item which will be used to generate corresponding world files when the layout is exported.

detaileddescription.para:
If no map was explicitly set via setReferenceMap(), the largest map in the layout will be returned (or nullptr if there are no maps in the layout).
setReferenceMap()

briefdescription.para: Refreshes the layout when global layout related options change.
Remove a custom property from the layout.
Removes an item from the layout.

detaileddescription.para: This should be called instead of the base class removeItem() method. The item will also be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Removes a multiFrame from the layout (but does not delete it).
Returns a reference to the layout's render context, which stores information relating to the current rendering settings for the layout.
Returns a reference to the layout's render context, which stores information relating to the current rendering settings for the layout.
Returns a reference to the layout's report context, which stores information relating to the current reporting context for the layout.
Returns a reference to the layout's report context, which stores information relating to the current reporting context for the layout.
Saves the layout as a template at the given file path.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns true if save was successful.
loadFromTemplate()

briefdescription.para: Returns list of selected layout items.

detaileddescription.para: If includeLockedItems is set to true, then locked items will also be included in the returned list.

briefdescription.para: Set a custom property for the layout.

parameterdescription.para: property key. If a property with the same key already exists it will be overwritten.

briefdescription.para: Sets the map item which will be used to generate corresponding world files when the layout is exported.
Clears any selected items and sets item as the current selection.
Sets the native measurement units for the layout.

detaileddescription.para:
These also form the default unit for measurements for the layout.
units()
convertToLayoutUnits()

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the layout's snapper, which stores handles layout snap grids and lines and snapping points to the nearest matching point.
Returns a reference to the layout's snapper, which stores handles layout snap grids and lines and snapping points to the nearest matching point.
Returns a pointer to the layout's undo stack, which manages undo/redo states for the layout and it's associated objects.
Returns a pointer to the layout's undo stack, which manages undo/redo states for the layout and it's associated objects.
Ungroups items by removing them from an item group and removing the group from the layout.

detaileddescription.para: Child items will remain in the layout and will not be deleted.
Returns a list of the items removed from the group, or an empty list if ungrouping was not successful.

briefdescription.para: Returns the native units for the layout.
Resets the z-values of items based on their position in the internal z order list.

detaileddescription.para: This should be called after any stacking changes which deferred z-order updates.

briefdescription.para: Returns the layout's state encapsulated in a DOM element.
Forces the layout, and all items contained within it, to refresh.

detaileddescription.para: For instance, this causes maps to redraw and rebuild cached images, html items to reload their source url, and attribute tables to refresh their contents. Calling this also triggers a recalculation of all data defined attributes within the layout.

briefdescription.para: Updates the scene bounds of the layout.
Is emitted when properties of the layout change.

detaileddescription.para: This signal is only emitted for settings directly managed by the layout, and is not emitted when child items change.

briefdescription.para: Is emitted when the layout has been refreshed and items should also be refreshed and updated.
Emitted whenever the selected item changes.

detaileddescription.para: If nullptr, no item is selected.

briefdescription.para: Emitted whenever the expression variables stored in the layout have been changed.
Adds a layout item to the layout, without adding the corresponding undo commands.
Calculates the item minimum position from an XML element.
Reads only the layout settings (not member settings like grid settings, etc) from XML.
Removes an item from the layout, without adding the corresponding undo commands.
Writes only the layout settings (not member settings like grid settings, etc) to XML.
Base class for layouts, which can contain items such as maps, labels, scalebars, etc.

detaileddescription.para: While the raw QGraphicsScene API can be used to render the contents of a QgsLayout to a QPainter, it is recommended to instead use a QgsLayoutExporter to handle rendering layouts instead. QgsLayoutExporter automatically takes care of the intracacies of preparing the layout and paint devices for correct exports, respecting various user settings such as the layout context DPI.
